body.p: stores the master files in a folder located in the ProjectNavigator view, as the first child of the project root. The Master Files Support is disabled by default. To enable it, select Enable Master Files Support from the Settings menu in the top-right corner of the Project view. You can also select Enable Master Files Support from the contextual menu of the Master Files directory, or from the contextual menu of the project itself.To enable it, select the Enable Master Files Support action from the contextual menu of the project folder. allows you to enable or disable the Master Files Support for each project you are working on.

When the Master Files Support is disabled, displays a window tip located at the bottom of the project view. This window contains an Enable button and a Read more link. Clicking the read more link takes you to the user guide. Clicking the Enable button opens the Enable Master Files dialog box. This dialog box contains general information about the Master Files Support and allows you to enable it. You can also use the Detect and Enable option to detect the master files from the current project. Once you close this window tip, hides it for all projects. You can make the window tip reappear by resetting to its default settings. However, doing so will result in you losing your customized options.
